page.title: 15St. Mary's Church, Ince.
page.content: Close to Ince Cemetery is the Anglican Church of St.Mary. The original church, dedicated in 1887, was erected at the corner of Warrington Road and Clarendon Street about 100 metres to the south of the present church. Over the years the ravages of mining subsidence, which affects large areas of Ince and Wigan, substantially damaged the once splendid red brick building. This eventually proved so devastating that in 1978 the church had to be abandoned and demolished. The congregation moved into temporary accommodation in the nearby St. Mary's Primary School. This Victor- ian building also needed extensive repairs and the children and staff had already moved into other more modern premises. Part of the building was later converted into the present church not as grand as the old St. Mary's per- haps, but certainly just as attractive.
